Sentencas: The solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) as an efficient and environmentally friendly energy conversion device can electrolyze steam efficiently and convert electricity into chemical energy.
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis

Sentencas: However, the lack of an efficient and stable oxygen electrode hinders the practical application of steam electrolysis in SOECs.
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis

Sentencas: In this paper, A-site deficiencies were incorporated into a Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-delta (BL95CFN) perovskite oxygen electrode.
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis

Sentencas: It has been confirmed that the introduction of an A-site deficiency effectively improves the concentration of oxygen vacancies, which promotes the surface exchange of oxygen and accelerates the oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis

Sentencas: In addition, after introducing the deficiency, the polarization impedance (R-p) of the BL95CFN oxygen electrode decreased from 0.162 to 0.087 Omega cm(2) at 800 degrees C. Furthermore, under a 50% H2O atmosphere at 800 degrees C, the current density of BL95CFN reached 1.860 A cm(-2) when the voltage reached 1.75 V, much higher than that of BL100CFN (1.428 A cm(-2)).
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis

Sentencas: Moreover, the A-site deficient BL95CFN demonstrated excellent performance in both short- and long-term stability, making it a promising candidate for application as a solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) oxygen electrode material.
Titulo: A-Site Deficiency Ba0.9La0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ Perovskite as Highly Active and Durable Oxygen Electrode for High-Temperature H2O Electrolysis
